title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 7T Calle Padre Janáriz
title_short: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 7T Calle Padre Janáriz
description: Ample parking on land. Good location in the urban area. If the Area is full, this is a good option. Very close to the center on foot. And safe

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 2T Calle Valladolid
description: Ample free parking for cars and motorhomes, large marked spaces for motorhomes. Gray emptying area, the sewage discharge and the water source DO NOT WORK, some motorhome has started it. Area near the center, next to the river and the bus station, bright and quiet to sleep. Without shadow.

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 19 Poligono Residencial
description: Small plot of land with the possibility of free public parking. Day and night. Close to the municipal swimming pools and a pipi_can. Uneven but fairly clean floor.

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 37 Calle Haza
description: Asphalted area, large place with garbage cans, does not seem to have restrictions

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 64 Avenida Castilla
description: Service Station where you can refill LPG gas

name: Camping Aranda de Duero Costajan
title: (09450) Camping Aranda de Duero Costajan
description: Camping Aranda de Duero Costajan. Plots in natural environment. Irregular and with shared light points and maybe a little far from depending on which plots. Lots of shade and very large bathrooms. huge pool. Restaurant until 10-11pm.

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 5 Calle Pisuerga
description: Laundry on the outskirts you can park large vehicles, park for kids and two bars to make the wait more enjoyable

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 15 Calle Duero
description: Parking on the outskirts of the city, is a car parking area, but there were many free places. In front there is a small area with trees. We only stop to eat, but it seems a good place, quiet.

title: (09491) Fresnillo de las Dueñas - 1 Diseminado Diseminados
title_short: (09491) Fresnillo de las Dueñas - 1 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Quiet place next to a hermitage, and near the Duero river. We only stopped to sleep.

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 82 Avenida Portugal
description: BEROIL gas station with free access toilet and shower. Mixed bathroom for both men and women.

title: (09400) Aranda de Duero - 2 Calle Pilde
description: Municipal swimming pools of Calabaza. Very well prepared and very large. Many trees.

title: (09491) Fresnillo de las Dueñas - 9 Calle San Sebastian
title_short: (09491) Fresnillo de las Dueñas - 9 Calle San Sebastian
description: Places along the playground of the village, on the banks of the Duero. 2 picnic tables and a drinking water fountain. Very quiet place with 3 houses, at the end of the village.

title: (09491) Fresnillo de las Dueñas - 264 N-122
description: FRESNILLO de las Dueñas. Small car park near exit N122 between Soria and Valadodid, and as there are few you will appreciate it!

title: (09471) Fuentespina - 84 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Path to the Hermit del Padre Eterno in Fuentespina. Shaded place with drinking water and games for children. We did not stay asleep but it looks peaceful. Bar and restaurant nearby.

title: (09471) Fuentespina - 94 Diseminado Diseminados
description:
Parking of the Fuentespina municipal swimming pool. There are 8 large motorhome sites even with good shade. You must arrive outside of pool hours, before 12 AM or after 8 PM.
We stayed with the motorhome for almost a week while we went to the Sonorama festival in Aranda de Duero.
The best location to fight the heat since you can go to the pool and they let you come and go as much as you want.

title: (09391) Castrillo de la Vega - 2 Camino Arroyo
title_short: (09391) Castrillo de la Vega - 2 Camino Arroyo
description: Area in flat grass with a lot of camper, vans, a playground, shade. I do not know what it is possible to do here but we had a moment to have lunch in the shade. Quiet place.

title: (09370) Gumiel de Izán - 924 Carretera de Madrid
title_short: (09370) Gumiel de Izán - 924 Carretera de Madrid
description: Quiet area with tables and a large parking area. There is a covered pediment, basketball courts and swings. It is a good place to rest and I do not think that they put up a problem to spend the night.

title: (09460) Milagros - 149 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Rest area with hot showers for two euros the showers are in the brasserie ask for the key in the bar

title: (09370) La Aguilera - 1 Avenida San Pedro Regalado
title_short: (09370) La Aguilera - 1 Avenida San Pedro Regalado
description: Parking next to the convent. Very quiet place to spend the day and night. In the convent they sell pastries.

title: (09491) Vadocondes - 18 Calle Santa Ana
description: Nice picnic area with tables in the shade. Barbecues Green area Next to the Duero River Drinking water next to the stone bridge

title: (09370) Gumiel de Izán - 281 Carretera de Madrid
title_short: (09370) Gumiel de Izán - 281 Carretera de Madrid
description: Garden with tables and water from a fountain. Quiet place with good shade.

title: (09460) Milagros - 54 Camino Lagares
description: Quiet place in front of old people's home, a playground and river next to it, very quiet

title: (09370) Gumiel de Izán - 339 Carretera Madrid
description: Parking of the Meson, shared with trucks. Very big. Insurance. We spend the night one night. There is a gas station opposite

title: (09460) Milagros - Unnamed Road
description: Possible parking in front of the Ermitage in ruins side of the river. Very quiet and hikes possible. No services

title: (09460) Milagros -
description: GREAT SPOT IN DRY WEATHER. To come, take the small path in front of the hermitage. A stream borders the premises. Fishing is possible. No service. For small motorhomes and vans. Large motorhomes can park in the hermitage car park and will have to take a walk to see if they can park. A few papers on the floor, nothing serious. The cicadas kept us company. Shade everywhere, it's one of the spots because people come to have their picnic. BE CAREFUL IN WINTERS OR AFTER HEAVY RAINS THE SPOT COULD TURN INTO A GALLEY.

title: (09490) San Juan del Monte -
description: Next to the chapel, water, trash, picnic tables, a bit of shade at the end of the day, van only for day-night parking, easy access but not large spaces, 2.3 vans max. The guardians of the chapel came by and showed us around, even ringing the bell. No problem staying the night so respectful of the place.

title: (09463) Haza - 29 Calle del Rincon
description: Flat concrete ground area on Castillo de HAZA with complete free service station, only 2,5 km away from N122 road (good paved access road). Note: arriving walls, turn left. Village located on hill top around small castle, very peaceful place. See photo for separated grey waters grid. Extended panorama all around; also sunset and stars night sky. Overnight is not prohibited. There is a bar with terrace in village. How to visit castle tower: 1) access internet and book visit for free; 2) you shall receive code to open door yourself. Take care of this interesting RV initiative, and the peaceful ambiance inside village.

title: (09463) Haza - 12 Calle Castillo
description: Apartment P on the village of HAZA located at the top of a hill which retains part of its visitable castle. For service station, see identified point. There is a bar with terrace and a rural house. Wide panorama all around; specially the sunset and the starry night sky. Tips for visiting the tower: 1) access the internet and book the visit for free; 2) they will send you a code to open the door of the castle yourself, once there is no one left to guide the visit. Take care of this initiative and the peace of those who live here.

title: (09462) Pardilla - 34 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Public playground for children near exit 143 of the A1 motorway (2km away). Perfect to stop to eat or rest for a while. Very well cared for, with a playground, fountain, picnic tables, trees and shade. In the town of Pardilla. It is fenced and does not have a schedule sign, but it looks like it is usually always open.

title: (09462) Adrada de Haza - BU-200
description: "la fuente del puente" is a source of drinking water at the foot of the road. Two powerful water jets to quickly fill cans and bottles. The water flows continuously.

title: (40542) Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela - 18 Calle Eras
title_short: (40542) Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela - 18 Calle Eras
description: Quiet parking in the village. Outdoor boundary of the natural park, so you can spend the night. From here you can start the first part of the Hoces del Riaza route. There are only 3 parking spaces for motorhomes, and they are not very well leveled. No type of service. Source to fill the water tank directly at the door of the church. You can sleep without any problem it is the only site authorized to be a private parking of the house of the park, told us the guard of the park.

address.city: Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela

title: (40542) Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela - Camino de Milagros
title_short: (40542) Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela - Camino de Milagros
description: Rest area surrounded by nature. Very quiet, 500 meters from the town, it is accessed by a compacted dirt track that is in front of the fronton track and runs parallel to the river, you have to go to the end where the signposted car park is. The track is suitable for 7m AC. Level parking.

address.city: Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela

title: (40542) Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela - Calle de la Cruz
title_short: (40542) Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela - Calle de la Cruz
description: Montero parking, near the town without shade or services, dirt access track in good condition for any vehicle, ideal to spend the day and rest, I do not recommend it to sleep due to the unevenness of the parking lot, routes to visit (they say) the The world's largest colony of vultures.

address.city: Montejo de la Vega de la Serrezuela

title: (09450) Hontoria de Valdearados - 29 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Hermitage Virgen de la Serna. In the middle of the field there are tables and a fountain with water. Access to the hermitage is on a slope, so it is best to park right at the entrance in the shade of two trees, this is the flattest part.

title: (09441) Sotillo de la Ribera - 35 Avenida Cid Campeador
title_short: (09441) Sotillo de la Ribera - 35 Avenida Cid Campeador
description: Area within the town with benches trees with shade fountain very quiet you can park vans and caravans there is no height limit. Is public

title: (09410) Peñaranda de Duero - 24 Calle la Muralla
title_short: (09410) Peñaranda de Duero - 24 Calle la Muralla
description: Parking of the castle of Peñaranda del Duero, surrounded by nature and with views of the village and its spectacular surroundings, good quiet place to spend the night, without services.

title: (09450) Hontoria de Valdearados - Unnamed road
description: Private estate parking. Quiet and perfect place to spend a night.

title: (09410) Peñaranda de Duero - 67 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Small picnic area with stone tables to make a short stop along the road. It is fenced, so you can park only along the quiet road. There is a fountain with good water and shade.

title: (09410) Peñaranda de Duero - 79 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Car park on the other side of the bridge. Shady place, space for several vehicles, very flat, very close to the city center. No services but very comfortable.

title: (09471) La Vid - 1 Calle Camino Real
description: Parking for cars and campers or AC of no more than 6 meters. In front of the monastery of Santa Maria.

title: (09410) Peñaranda de Duero - 4 BU-923
description: Flat area beside old football pitch. On top of plateau with lovely views and sunsets.

title: (09462) La Sequera de Haza - 6 Diseminado Diseminados
title_short: (09462) La Sequera de Haza - 6 Diseminado Diseminados
description:
Shady place for children's games, Drinking water fountain.
1 location.

title: (09462) - 45 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Easily accessible picking area with fountain and children's play area in a poplar. Ideal for stopping en route to eat or rest

title: (09410) Peñaranda de Duero - 37 Diseminado Diseminados
description: We looked for this place as an alternative to the castle, since it was said that young people made a bottle there. It is next to a hermitage that is only used during the pilgrimage in September. There is only one gap. Next to it there is a path where the locals usually walk. There are benches along the way and small wastebaskets. We have spent a very quiet Saturday night. It is a good option to spend the night and visit the town. Nearby there is a playground.

title: (09315) Fuentecén - N-122
description: Truck parking lot next to a gas station. Well lid at night and pretty quiet as off the main road. Cafe opens in the morning at 8am with clean rest rooms and showers avail as well.

title: (40542) Valdevacas de Montejo - Cam. de Casuar
title_short: (40542) Valdevacas de Montejo - Cam. de Casuar
description: Small parking for 3 maby 4 cars. Half of this one is flat. About 2km to enter of Senda Hoces del Río Riaza Valdevacas de Montejo. Silence night. Sometimes windy. There is small shelter which security before weather conditions. Nice view from nearest hills.

title: (09471) La Vid - 124 Calle Diseminado
description: Parking near a small dam pretty good and wide road quiet place to spend the day and night

title: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta -
description: Quiet place to spend the night not far from the highway. In the middle of nature, with good views. With a little incline.

title: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Unnamed Road
description: Ideal for car and sleep there

title: (40554) Segovia - Unnamed Road
description: Very quiet place to spend a day, and start an excursion to the gorges of the Riaza river.

title: (09300) - 173 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Location, large, with BBQ and tables, lots of shade and a small park.

title: (09300) Roa - 30 Calle los Corrales
description: Town car park. Small road to access but plenty of space to turn. Flat area with lovely views below town

title: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Madrid - Burgos
title_short: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Madrid - Burgos
description: Rest area with a hermitage on the side. It is a beautiful place if you want to rest with nature (although I understand that there is noise from the highway that passes nearby). There is a fountain and little else, but we thought it was a very charming place.

title: (09300) Roa - 2B Avenida Rey Juan Carlos I
title_short: (09300) Roa - 2B Avenida Rey Juan Carlos I
description: Roa area, new with unbeatable views

title: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place surrounded by nature near the highway. Ideal to rest from the trip. No services. only one square

title: (09410) Valverde -
description: It is away from everything...it has flat areas to park...it could fit 2 cars...almost no one passes by, and it is a very quiet area to spend the night.

title: (09410) Arandilla - 118 Lugar Diseminado
description:
A good place to spend the day , very level and calm, there is a source of drinking water.
It is a small town with a shop, bar and a park for children.

name: Área descanso el Miliario
title: (40541) Área descanso el Miliario
description: Area of descanso, no services just open parking area with rubbish bins next to A1 to Burgos.

title: (09410) Arandilla - 18 Lugar Diseminado
description: Very quiet area that has tables to eat, you can spend the night quietly.

title: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Madrid - Burgos
title_short: (40541) Honrubia de la Cuesta - Madrid - Burgos
description: rest area with parking and picnic areas, with shade, next to the highway. without services.

title: (09451) Caleruega - 25 Calle Prado de las Merinas
title_short: (09451) Caleruega - 25 Calle Prado de las Merinas
description: Quiet place next to the picnic area, soccer field and swimming pools, with a children's play area. We spent a very quiet night. Without services but with a source to collect water. The city is worth a visit for its monumental complex.

title: (40542) Valdevacas de Montejo - 8B Calle de la Fuente
title_short: (40542) Valdevacas de Montejo - 8B Calle de la Fuente
description: With an access in good condition, you can access a hermitage where the local people (MORAL DE HORNUEZ) venerate the patron saint of the place. A very large, quiet and well-kept green area with centuries-old junipers and junipers. There is a fox that is like the Yogi Bear, it is around you to see if you give it something to eat.

title: (09451) Caleruega - 28 Calle Santo Domingo
description: Great newly built car park, very close to the old town, asphalted and flat, I did not stay overnight, I was passing through and I did not see restrictions of any kind, ideal for visiting the municipality

title: (40554) Maderuelo - Cam. de los Valles
description: Access by a track only in 4x4, beautiful quiet place

title: (40554) Maderuelo - Cam. a Maderuelo
description: Parking area next to a reservoir. We slept in December and absolutely no one passed. The site is very beautiful and is away from roads, so it is very quiet. The views, beautiful.

title: (09451) Caleruega - 21 BU-910
description: Small area with many tables in the shade, 2 barbecues and games for children. Garbage dumpster. Source for obtaining water.

title: (42320) Langa de Duero - 15 Calle Real
description: Parking to visit the town of Langa de Duero. Under the church of San Miguel Arcángel

title: (40554) Maderuelo -
description: Fantastic location near the water with shade options. There is enough space and it is very quiet. From your camper you can immediately go into the water for a refreshing dive. The only downside is that the terrain is skewed, but there are creative solutions for this. From this place you can visit different villages, paddle, rent a canoe, cycle, walk,...

title: (09318) Nava de Roa - BU-131
description: Shaded picnic area with several tables. Playground for children, small football/basketball field.

title: (09461) Fuentenebro - SG-V-2414
description: Picnic area overlooking the serrezuela with shaded tables and fountain, but completely overgrown,

title: (09451) Arauzo de Torre - 56 BU-V-9211
description: Public faucet

title: (40554) Maderuelo - 126 SG-945
description: Quiet place next to the lake and near the town of Maderuelo.

title: (40554) Maderuelo - 15 Carretera Aranda
description:
Parking accessible with motorhome 6.50m. It's August 4th and it's practically empty.
 nearby town
 lake 10 min walk down quiet path from picnic hike parking lot 200m shaded and one more lake
 water fountain in the corner of the parking lot. If you turn left just out of the car park, there is a sloping grate, perfect for emptying greywater.

title: (40554) Maderuelo - 125 SG-945
description: This is an signed motorhome car park. No services, but there is a working tap under a cover in the centre. Located on the the Maderuelo river. We can stay overnight, flatish ground, ok with chocks. Pretty town, bar restaurant across the road.

title: (09410) Coruña del Conde - 56 Carretera Aranda Salas
title_short: (09410) Coruña del Conde - 56 Carretera Aranda Salas
description: Small village with a ruined castle. and very close to the remains of Clunia Sulpicia

title: (40532) Aldeanueva de la Serrezuela - Carretera Aldeanueva de la Serrezuela
title_short: (40532) Aldeanueva de la Serrezuela - Carretera Aldeanueva de la Serrezuela
description: Quiet place, about 1 km from the town where you can have lunch or dinner. Park with slide for children, picnic area with tables, benches and barbecue

title: (42329) Bocigas de Perales - 75 Barrio San Juan
title_short: (42329) Bocigas de Perales - 75 Barrio San Juan
description: Incredible view of the horns, with water and tranquility.

title: (40529) Alconada de Maderuelo - 2 Calle de Abajo
title_short: (40529) Alconada de Maderuelo - 2 Calle de Abajo
description: Very beautiful town. An ideal place to spend the day. Free camping outside. No problem. There are no services. Festivities on the 1st Sunday of August.

title: (09454) Peñalba de Castro - 41 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Archaeological site of the Roman city of Clunia. Stop at the entrance to obtain the tickets, and you can continue with the motorhome to a parking lot on the upper plateau to visit the entire site. Open during visiting hours of the archaeological site. No services.

title: (09349) Cilleruelo de Abajo - BU-V-1106
description: Good and wide area of services to rest or spend the night. It has a restaurant and hotel.

title: (09454) Peñalba de Castro - 7 Calle Clunia
description: Very calm meadow in the city. Without services Very quiet. Free

title: (09349) Fontioso - Unnamed Road
description: 800 m from the BP gas station and truck parking is the old Fontioso railway station. Quiet and flat. Dogs and children can play as there is no traffic. Only the sound of the highway can be heard in the distance.

title: (09610) Espinosa de Cervera - 22 BU-911
description: Parking of an old restaurant and hotel complex, now abandoned. At the entrance of the town. Very quiet place for the night and the visit to the place and its small Romanesque church. Without services

title: (09451) Arauzo de Miel - 14 Calle San Martin
title_short: (09451) Arauzo de Miel - 14 Calle San Martin
description: Friendly town and beautiful place to rest.

title: (40237) Sacramenia - 1A Camino Laguna de Contreras
description: Quite large parking with space for several motorhomes. We have not slept here but we do not see any problem to do so. It is at the entrance of Sacramenia. If you come from Peñafiel, avoid entering Calle Real as it is quite narrow, go around the town and enter from the bottom.

title: (09430) Huerta de Rey - 37 Camino Salcejo
description: Free and recently created service area (still unfinished). To spend the night, go to the motorhome area located in the recreational area (very nice). In the town you have all the services and it is covered in luxury. Thank you very much to the city council for the initiative.

title: (09430) Huerta de Rey - 7 Calle Diseminados
description: Overnight area next to recreational area, games park, water source, 500 m from the municipal swimming pool, 1 km from the town along a beautiful walk along the ditch that leaves the source or along the road. Routes on foot and by bike start from here. Next to it is the Huerta de Rey via ferrata. In the town you have all the services. Thank you very much to the city council for the initiative.

title: (42320) San Esteban de Gormaz - Unnamed Road
title_short: (42320) San Esteban de Gormaz - Unnamed Road
description: At the edge of the river Duero. quiet. Good spot for a picnic

title: (09430) - 9 Calle Diseminados
description: Area near the municipal pool and picnic. 2 minutes from Via Ferrata and bike paths or hikes.

title: (47186) Valladolid -
description: Small parking in front of the "beach" of the reservoir of Encinas de Esgueva. We spent the day not at night, there were a lot of parked cars, a fairly uneven area. It's nice to spend the day and eat by the water. If you arrive early, you can park in the shade of the trees.

title: (09430) Huerta de Rey - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area with barbecues and tables, flat and grassy. minor road

title: (09430) Huerta de Rey - BU-925
description: El espliego picnic area, picnic area, tables, barbecues, drinking water fountain, lots of shade,

title: (09610) Hinojar de Cervera - Unnamed Road
description: Quiet place surrounded by nature and animals near Peña Cervera. 1km away is the Yecla gorge with a bar

title: (40569) Grajera - Carretera de Madrid a Burgos
title_short: (40569) Grajera - Carretera de Madrid a Burgos
description: Petrol station with plenty of parking and water. Nothing else. No bread.

title: (40357) Fuentidueña - Camino de la Cañamera
description:
Just nature! 
Perfect to spend the night.

title: (09631) Doña Santos - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area, Pinarejos, tables, fountain with many shadows Children's play castle

title: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos - 3 BU-910
description: Small quiet picnic area next to little busy side street. Stone tables and some stools. Next door flows a small stream.

title: (40518) Castiltierra -
description: Site removed from the road, incredible views and in the middle of nowhere. Absolute silence, flat, without shadow and a very special peace reigns.

title: (09610) - 7 Diseminado Hinojar Cerv
description: You can visit the Yecla gorge and in a few km you can visit Covarrubias, it has a picnic area with stone tables and a restaurant

title: (40357) Fuentidueña - 4 Camino Vencias
description: Picnic area next to the river and with a view of the city, bar, playground, benches and barbecue. Parking area and space to park next to the river on the grass. No camping. Pretty town with castle walls and ruins. Water tap in the picnic area (accessible from the parking lot on the grass).

title: (40357) Fuentidueña - 1 Calle Carretera
description: On the other side of the river, a recreation area with tables, beach bar, lawn and swings. But paved and with a tree that gives shade. Next to a house. In Ruffino, we eat an extraordinary lamb. Other chiringuitos with paellas and very rich chickens. There is a fountain next to the bridge.

title: (09610) Santibáñez del Val - Camino de Santa Cecilia
title_short: (09610) Santibáñez del Val - Camino de Santa Cecilia
description: Beautiful recreation area next to the rural Romanesque gem, the Hermitage of Santa Cecilia, with picnic areas next to the Mataviejas river and in the shade of tall poplars. Due to the narrowness of the road, perhaps very large motorhomes cannot pass.

title: (40357) Fuentidueña - 22 Calle Cucurrulleras
description: Quiet place in the necropolis of San Martin in Villa de Fuentidueña. Downstream with beach bars, drinking water and bath. Climbing area 50 meters below the wall. Narrow rise.

title: (47300) Peñafiel - 7B Camino Bodegas Protos
description: It is a parking lot for cars next to Bodegas Protos and the totally empty cemetery where you can spend a very quiet night.

title: () Peñafiel - 56 Carretera Pesquera
description: Great pine forest with SHADOW !!, ideal to rest and although not less spending the night, it seems a quiet place despite passing a road.

title: (40594) Ayllón - N-110
description: Easy access leisure area, very close to the hermitage of Santa María de Riaza. Very wooded, with barbecues and water source. At the foot of the path for walkers between towns.

title: (40594) Ayllón - 8 Plaza Iglesia
description:
Quiet and safe town to stop, at this point, next to the church, there is a playground.
The views are spectacular and the residents of the town are very nice.
The road can be heard a little.

title: (40332) San Miguel de Bernuy -
description: Beautiful place by the water. Large parking lot at Chiringuito with kayak rental. During the day work in the bar and at the reservoir. From 8pm the bar is closed and it is very quiet.

title: (47300) - 9007 Calle Subida al Castillo
description: Castle parking. Few places but flat and calm, without service. Not suitable for motorhomes

title: () Peñafiel - 40 Calle de los Destiladeros
description: Parking in 3 levels. Convenient to visit the city, the castle and the wine museum. Slightly sloping.

title: (40529) Corral de Ayllón - Carretera Saldaña
description: Small picnic area with 5 tables in a pine forest. Very dry, be careful with making fire. There is no service but it is very quiet. Access somewhat narrow. Watch out for the branches. There is room for about 3 camper. Nothing special but very quiet. Take care of it please.

title: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos - BU-910
description: On these dates (summer 2020, the other parking lot, although there is room to leave the AC is full of grain or arid). This is next to the soccer field, has a fountain to the left of the access ramp (going down) and a grass floor. Although there are no shadows, it is much more bearable than the other one that is made of asphalt. It is a fairly large and wide area.

title: (47300) Peñafiel - 24 Plaza Flor
description: This free parking is a quieter place than the one in the castle area. It is 5 minutes from downtown and next to the national highway

title: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos - 3 Calle la Cadena
title_short: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos - 3 Calle la Cadena
description: Parking place to visit Santo Domingo and departure route.

title: (47300) Peñafiel - 19D Calle Calvario
description:
Launderette. 
Machines ONLY take 1 euro coins. Our 12kg wash took 34 mins and the drier dried the whole lot pretty well with one drying cycle. Detergent provided and included in the price and automatically dispensed.

title: () Peñafiel - 13D Calle Mercado Viejo
description: Calle del Mercado Viejo is a wide avenue with trees and service road with good parking spaces where you can spend the night without problems. It can be a good option if someone does not dare to spend the night in the parking lot at the base of the castle.

title: (42141) Guijosa - Unnamed Road,
description: In the town of Guijosa next to the bar there is a parking lot with a fountain, we recharge water and we sleep in the esplanade of the pediment, without any problem and those of the phenomenal town. We commented that in August there is more noise because of the chiquilleria that stays late. The town is 9 km from the Lobos River Canyon, there is less trouble sleeping than in the canyon because it is at the gates of the natural park.

title: (40520) Ayllón - 18Z Travesía Temiño
description: Very quiet location on parking along the river. No shade. Friendly village at 300 m with market on the plazza mayor on Thursday morning.

title: (09610) Abbey of Santo Domingo de Silos - 36 Calle de Santo Domingo
title_short: (09610) Abbey of Santo Domingo de Silos - 36 Calle de Santo Domingo
description: Large tarmac parking near hiking trails (GR32)

address.city: Abbey of Santo Domingo de Silos

title: (40520) Ayllón - 2 Calle Dehesa
description: Street parking next to a park/playground with water tap on a quiet street near the centre of the town with restaurants and bakery within walking distance. There are public toilets around the corner too although they were closed when we were here.

title: (40332) San Miguel de Bernuy - 2D Calle del Calvario
title_short: (40332) San Miguel de Bernuy - 2D Calle del Calvario
description: Gravel parking at one end of town, next to the river. Totally quiet.

title: (40520) Ayllón - 10D Calle Adarves
description: Ground parking five minutes from the town center with shops, bakeries, etc. super quiet

title: (09347) Ura - 98 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Ura car park, next to the river, picnic tables, games area and in the center of the village a source of drinking water. Ideal for making the excursion through the arlanza de Ura to Castro, 2.5 km, suitable for children, vulture watching.

title: (40235) Aldeasoña - 32 Carretera Peñafiel
description: mxc possibilities

title: (09340) Lerma - 22 Calle Cura Merino
description: Very large parking

title: (40514) Ayllón -
description: Large parking with trees. trash but no services.

title: () Peñafiel - Calle Vivero
description: We spent a quiet night here on the edge of the forest, the forest isn't quite as full of rubbish as closer to town.

title: (40332) San Miguel de Bernuy - SG-V-2411
description: Quiet area, cement, at the top it is flat. In front is the Frontón del pueblo and you can also park and spend the night. Right next to the town, the municipal swimming pool bar and canoe rental centers

title: (09612) Pinilla de los Barruecos - 1 BU-V-9215
description: Abandoned recreational area. ideal for eating and sleeping. without any amenities. you can barbecue inside the shelter. Quiet.

title: (40332) San Miguel de Bernuy - 16 Calle Ermita
title_short: (40332) San Miguel de Bernuy - 16 Calle Ermita
description: Fenced area next to the Duratón river, quite compacted natural earth pavement. There are paddle tennis courts, a park... surrounded by trees and fenced. We spent a day with children and puppies and it was great, the puppies were controlled by being fenced, shaded in the afternoon by the river trees. There are canoe rental companies right next door and a gas station.

title: (09340) Lerma - 33 Paseo Vista Alegre
description: Dirt parking just behind the bullring, very quiet and close to the old town. We spent the night very quiet.

title: (09347) Santillán del Agua - 15 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Artificial beach (The dam). Very nice place with picnic tables, swings and there is a grill area, but it does not have the grills. A little further on from the swings there is a dam and a very nice area to swim and to walk with dogs. Quite a large area to park with very large motorhomes. Good access. there are 2 large garbage cans. There are no services.

title: (42141) Espeja de San Marcelino -
description: Convent of the Jerónimos de Guijosa, wide esplanade with water fountain, there are stone picnic tables, access is not complicated, it is accessed from the road from Guijosa to Espeja de San Marcelino by a track that goes to the right hand side, from the road you see the ruins, no problem to spend the night. You can enter with motorhome without much complication, the road is dirt. The place is near the town of Guijosa, there is a bar in the village and the baker goes every day at 11 to distribute the bread to Guijosa.

title: (40514) Ayllón - 8 Calle Egido
description: Nice water from a spring, with tap!

title: (09340) Lerma - 8 Calle de la Estación
description: Perfect to spend a night and visit the city

title: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz -
description:
A peaceful and pretty spot deceptively close to the main road but quiet and tucked away. 

Off a dirt track alongside the Douro River -I believe a service track for the power lines. 
Enter through the industrial estate, no signs prohibiting access. 

Track was easily drivable in my Sprinter despite recent rain. Walk ahead and check if unsure. 

Very flat and loads of places to choose from, trees let you stay out of view of the road. some slight road noise in the day but very peaceful at night. 

I was here in late October and the trees were beautiful yellow and orange, lots of wildlife & large river runs alongside. I didn't go very far but sure you can find access from the bank. 
 if you have a 4x4 you could really explore this area. 

If no wind, lots of insects in the evening, to be extracted near water, but no problems in the daytime. 

In conclusion, a nice find if you don't want to detour far from your route

title: (09347) Quintanilla del Agua - 13 Calle Pielagos
description: Nice place next to the river, with 2 picnic tables and surrounded by trees so it gives shade, there is also good cover. Fit about 6 vans.

name: Camping Riberduero
title: (47300) Camping Riberduero
description: Camping Riberduero is a small rustic and quiet campsite in the heart of the Ribera del Duero. The campsite has 10 bungalows, 40 pitches, a swimming pool and restaurant and is located 1 km from the city of Peñafiel (supermarkets, bars / restaurants, castle, etc.).

title: (40332) Cobos de Fuentidueña - 4 Camino Eras
description:
Very small town, very charming and very quiet, ideal for hiking and cycling, small beach by the river, ideal for children. We slept two nights with no problems.
It has a beach bar on the other side of the river and a small bar in the town square that is only open on weekends.
very quiet to be with children.
Possibility of canoeing in San Miguel de Bernuy (2.5 km). The town is between the Burguillos and Vencias dams.

title: (40530) Barbolla - 3 Calle Eras
description: A fairly quiet street on the outskirts of town, we spent a night and very well, very friendly people, cafeteria. Good place to take a break.

title: (09340) Lerma - 50 Урбанисасьон Уэртас Бахас
description: Area next to Las Palmeras motorhome area

title: (09340) Lerma - 3 Paseo de los Mesones
description: Unpaved area. level. Next to the river. Traffic noise. Quiet enough. There is a fountain and public services. Next to the city center

title: (40560) Boceguillas - 3X Diseminado Cr Madrid
description: Huge parking lot with hundreds of spaces. There is no service. A restaurant next door. Located next to the highway. Convenient for a meal or night pose.

name: Área de autocaravanas Lerma | Las Palmeras
title: (09340) Área de autocaravanas Lerma | Las Palmeras
title_short: (09340) Área de autocaravanas Lerma | Las Palmeras
description: Private and recently inaugurated motorhome area. The owner is very friendly and attentive at all times. If you want to visit Lerma or if you are passing through, it is highly recommended.

title: (09340) Lerma - 9 Camino el Parque
description: Site with tables to eat, playground for children, football field to play, near municipal swimming pools...

title: (09340) Lerma - 4 Camino el Parque
description: Parking next to an institute and municipal swimming pools. Wide and without services. We slept three motorhomes and we were very quiet

title: (40331) Carrascal del Río - 4 SG-V-2411
description: Picnic area with playground and river. There is a 5km route that goes to the next well-marked town. And two other routes from the town that come together and can be used. Containers. There should be a forbidden camping signal

title: (09340) Lerma - BU-904
description: Small path for spot van at the edge of a river, quiet for a quiet night.

title: (42142) Espejón - Camino a Espejón
description:
Beautiful place to spend the night or spend the day. You can park practically anywhere and there are several drinking fountains and picnic areas with barbecues.
You breathe a lot of peace, silence and tranquility since not many people pass by.
It is near the hermitage of the town of Espejón next to an extensive forest full of paths, rivers, fountains, caves and routes to walk or bike. (Espejon is about 3km away by asphalt)
The stars at night are amazing...

title: (47315) Pesquera de Duero - 23 Calle Nevera
description: Area next to the Duero, with tables, benches and barbecue. Quiet. To stop or sleep. You have to walk to get there. Ground entry but no problem. Shade of poplars. Litter bins. And a bridge and a town with good local wine!

title: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos -
description:
Place with a beautiful view of the surrounding mountains, pretty much 360°. 
When you drive the road you have to take a small path up the mountain. 4x4 recommendable, but I did it with my minivan without 4x4. probably a little harder with a camper, but if you made it to Sad Hill you could probably also get here. 
Not completely level, but it's not the worst. Enough spots for multiple vans, with a lot of choice.

title: (47315) Valladolid - 5 Extrarradio Diseminados
description: Campa of the hermitage of San Isidro on the outskirts of the town of Pesquera de Duero. In the middle of the wine route, and surrounded by vineyards. Charming and quiet place to arrive, follow the path of the cheese factory.

title: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos - Camino de Santo Domingo de Silos
title_short: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos - Camino de Santo Domingo de Silos
description: Flat clearance at the end of a small path, space surrounded by small cliffs, no shade from the trees, but in the shade in the evening, so cool. We parked two 6.5m motorhomes without any problem. Further down, the filming location of the good the bad and the ugly (very steep, I do not recommend going down in a motorhome). The track from Santo Domingo de silos is wide and accessible by motorhome.

address.street: Camino de Santo Domingo de Silos

title: (09610) Santo Domingo de Silos -
description: Location set back from the track, on the curve at the height of the hill. Beautiful 360 view. T We passed the shepherd and his goats who didn't tell us anything. A little wind that fell during the night. Beautiful sky.

title: (09347) Puentedura - 25 Calle del Río
description: Ideal parking for a very quiet night and day. Very close bathing area Drinking water source at the entrance next to the bridge.

title: (09347) Puentedura - 11 Calle del Río
description: River area without services. Quiet, shade, grass, next to the town

title: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz - 13 Calle Alameda III
title_short: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz - 13 Calle Alameda III
description: Picnic area with tables, benches, barbecue, showers, fountain and river perfect for swimming in the summer. Ideal for stopping to eat and rest.

title: (09613) Contreras - Camino de Santo Domingo de Silos
title_short: (09613) Contreras - Camino de Santo Domingo de Silos
description:
Superb and quiet place right next to the Sad Hill cemetery, filming location of "the good, the bad and the ugly". For the fearful one must know that there is no death. It's just a movie set. We had a really peaceful night in beautiful scenery.
The roads to get there are chaotic but passable. you have to roll slowly.

address.street: Camino de Santo Domingo de Silos

title: (42141) Fuencaliente del Burgo - 9 Calle Espeja
description: On the edge of a village next to the soccer field and the local weighbridge, with a view of the hills and fields. Little passing traffic. Calm.

title: (09613) Contreras -
description: 360 degree view, all alone. Slept great here. From the (gravel) road you have to go a small piece of unpaved. For small camper vans, 4x4 no problem at all, large campers perhaps more difficult. The place is still completely clean, let's all keep it that way ;).

title: (09390) Villalmanzo - 49 Arrabal Zona de Bodegas
description: Area with picnic tables. Lots of shade, water fountain, barbecues. Along the road. Good place to stop for lunch.

title: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz - 3 Plaza Escuelas
title_short: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz - 3 Plaza Escuelas
description: Parking for the day. There are around 10 motorhomes and it is around 50 meters from the Information and Tourism Office. I don't know if you can stay overnight, even though it is very close to the road and there may be some noise

title: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz - 47 Paseo de La Rambla
title_short: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz - 47 Paseo de La Rambla
description: Peaceful place beside the river, perfect to stop and eat.

title: (40331) Burgomillodo - Unnamed Road
description: Dirt parking, in the center of town next to the Duraton river, in a quiet town with a couple of bars/restaurants, children's playground on the other side of the river in front of the car park, the access is uphill but wide enough for AC and vans large and long right next to the entrance to the hydroelectric plant, the surface is very level, on one side there is a small wooden table and right from the parking lot the path that goes up to the dam wall begins, which is highly recommended, very quiet night that if careful with the mosquitoes.

title: (42330) San Esteban de Gormaz -
description: Place next to the soccer field and sports center, without services, we have spent a quiet night without problems

title: (40317) Sepúlveda - 4 Calle Pozo
description: Parking in the center of the village of Villaseca, no service, shops nearby.

title: () Carrascal del Río - Camino a Ermita de San Frutos
title_short: () Carrascal del Río - Camino a Ermita de San Frutos
description: Parking in the nature park. Duratón River. Hermitage of San Frutos.

address.street: Camino a Ermita de San Frutos

title: (40300) Sepúlveda - 1 Plaza Lavadero
description: Old Sepúlveda laundry. Area with two picnic tables next to a grove of trees

title: (40300) Sepúlveda - Camino Puerta de la Fuerza
title_short: (40300) Sepúlveda - Camino Puerta de la Fuerza
description: The path you arrive on is a concrete track, you pass a fronton and you arrive at what seems to be a typical route on the locals' walk, it is a quiet place with a good sunset.

title: (40300) Sepúlveda - 7 Calle el Postiguillo
description: Parking big enough and flat very close to the main square of the village. Quiet for a night without problems.

title: (40300) Sepúlveda - 3 Plaza San Esteban
description: Public parking. Very close to visit the old town. The only drawback is that it is a bit steep.

title: (40331) Navalilla - 16 Travesía del Calvario
description: Picnic zone. With barbecues. Playground. Grass. Picnic tables. Source

title: (09640) Hortigüela - 22 BU-905
description:
Tucked away spot next to river.

✔ trees and shade
✔ spots in the sun
✔ river

❌ no services

title: (40300) Sepúlveda - 3 Carretera Segovia
description: Parking very close to the town. It has route walking to the Duratón river

title: (09341) Tordómar - 79 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Huge esplanade next to the road. Ideal to stop passing without deviating. Quite a lot of traffic and a bell tower next to it that plays all hours of the night.

title: () Sepúlveda - SG-V-2323
description: Parking at the entrance of the canyon of Rio Duratón. Slightly inclined. No service. Large village 1.1 km.

title: (09613) Contreras - Camino a Contreras
description: Beautiful place that we found by chance on our way to Sad Hill. The road to get there was closed and it was late. Parking at the foot of an antenna that you can hardly hear. We have a 360 degree view over the valley. There is a water tank where the locals bathe just below the spot but we didn't dare! 4G coverage. No shade. Fountain with drinking water at the start of the path leading to the spot. There is also a spring below the spot with water for washing and doing the dishes.

title: (40380) -
description: Accessed by sandy roads, the best place is from the village of Sebúlcor, very quiet area with shady areas for vegetation. It has no electricity, no water, no garbage containers.

title: (09346) Covarrubias - 11 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Small parking lot on the banks of the Arlanza River, picnic area with barbecues and tables, plenty of shade and cool, quiet during the week, perfect to go with kennels, start of route of a stretch of the road of El Cid. There is no water source, but there is a chiringuito next door and containers for garbage.

title: (40331) Burgomillodo -
description: Parking area next to the viewpoint of the Convent of Nuestra Señora de la Hoz, in Hoces del Duratón. It is a quiet area, not very easy to access, but it is worth reaching.

title: (09346) Covarrubias - 5A Calle Tenerias Bajas
description: Small car park (10 spaces), going down a ramp to the left after crossing the road bridge, which comes from Sto. Silos Sunday. There are no signs that prevent parking and overnight in that place. Located in the very center of the town, with many restaurants, bars, monuments and streets with houses that give a totally medieval aspect to the old town. It is recommended to visit and purchase typical and artisan products (pasta, bread, black pudding, etc.)

name: Camping Covarrubias
title: (09346) Camping Covarrubias
description: Camping Covarrubias with access to the swimming pool.

name: Area de Autocaravanas Covarrubias
title: (09346) Area de Autocaravanas Covarrubias
description: The aire has moved further along the road and is now a large gravel area with new drive. Waste disposa and potable water. The site is on a slope.

title: (09341) Santa Cecilia -
description: Place in the middle of nature on the edge of a small road. We stopped at the end of the afternoon in the shelter of a small grove. Very quiet and perfectly flat. Virtually no traffic. Excellent night.

title: (09640) Hortigüela - 17-19 BU-905
description: Ruined church, lots of charm

title: (09346) Covarrubias -
description: Esplanade next to the Hermitage of San Olav, on the outskirts of Covarrubias. The intersection is well marked, and the track is in good condition for all types of vehicles. Quiet site, with routes from the same parking lot.

title: (09611) Villanueva de Carazo - 23 Calle Centro
description: Magnificent semi-uninhabited town. Many places to park. Absolute tranquility. There are various manholes where gray can possibly be emptied, there is a fountain but it seems not to work.

title: (40317) Sepúlveda - 6 SG-V-2418
description: Shaded parking. Access by a road - (80 m). Departure of hike in the canyon (magnificent), regulated access, inquire at the park house in Sepulveda. Forbidden nights.

title: (40317) Villar de Sobrepeña - 2 Calle Zumaque
description: Place to catch water

title: (09640) Hortigüela - 15 BU-905
description: Torcon Recreation Area: Large space with shadows, barbecue area and fountain with little water. Very quiet to sleep despite being near a road where there is virtually no traffic. It has two areas, with two accesses, we were in the second, closer to Covarrubias because it seemed more discreet. The river Arlanza passes nearby and the area of ​​flames "El Torcon".

title: (40317) Villar de Sobrepeña - SG-V-2323
description: Quite place during the night , in the morning maybe some people will pass walking or cycling but it’s in general a quite place surrounded by nature. Very close to San Miguel Miguel de Neguera ( lees than 1’ walking) and next to hoces del Duratón by car.

title: (09611) Hacinas - Camino de la Revilla
description: Flat grassy area behind a church, under the village. 50m from the road, not very busy.

title: (40593) - 11 Diseminado Cr N-i
description: It is a gas station with truck parking, there are many sleeping

title: (40500) Riaza - 20 Calle General Mola
description: They have expanded the parking lot. Some noise from people coming to visit the town soon, but okay. Enabled loading and unloading area. Maximum stay 48h

title: (40512) Villacorta - 21 Callejón Iglesia
description: Place to make a stop and visit the town. You could spend the night because the road has very little traffic. 1 minute walk from the town. No access to the town is very narrow.

title: (40500) Riaza - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the viewpoint of the flat stones, at the end of the recreational area of ​​the Ermita de Hontanares. It is dirt, quite flat in the middle of the oak forest. Without services, perfect to spend a night and watch the sunset. There are no shadows

title: (09346) Covarrubias -
description: Parking near the hermitage of the Virgen de las Mamblas. Although on the way there are many quite flat and wide places to park, this one is just 100 meters from the hermitage, at the edge of the track that leads to it. The track is in good condition for all types of vehicles, and it is taken just at the Covarrubias exit, towards Mecerreyes. The crossing is well indicated. The Camino del Cid passes through here, and there are several routes to do, both on foot and by mountain bike.

title: (40380) Sebúlcor - 5 Plaza Fragua
description: Parking, wonderful canoe trip through the gorges of the Duraton river. For more information, please go to the website or call

title: (40330) Fuenterrebollo - Unnamed Road
description: Ground parking next to the municipal swimming pools of Fuenterrebollo. It is on the outskirts of town. Outdoor bar and tables in the outdoor area of the pools. Shade. To spend the night and go to the pools the next day is very good.

title: (40500) Riaza - Calle Cañada la Estación
description: Gym parking, flat and close to the city center. View of the "La pinilla" ski resort.
